p: Other bacterial endemic diseases include melioidosis and glanders which, although not caused by zoonotic pathogens, are endemic in Southeast Asia where the bacteria reside in soil and are transmitted to humans through occupational exposure, e.g. working in paddy fields 48. Another bacterial disease which is endemic in the northern hemisphere is tularaemia, caused by the bacterium Francisella tularensis, which has zoonotic reservoirs in the rabbit, hare and rodent populations in the South, Central and western United States and is transmitted to man by ticks and biting flies 49.
